required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of F-627 and GRAN®
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multi-Center, Randomized, Open-Label, Active-Controlled Trial to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of F-627 and GRAN® in the Prophylactic Treatment for Chemotherapy-Induced Neutropenia

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase III, Multi-Center, Randomized, Open-Label, Active-Controlled Trial to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of Recombinant Human Granulocyte Colony Stimulating Factor-Fc Fusion Protein (F-627) and Recombinant Human Granulocyte Colony Stimulating Factor (GRAN®) in the Prophylactic Treatment for Chemotherapy-Induced Neutropenia

detailed_description.textblock:
Protocol Number: SP11631 Study Stage: Phase III Study Population Female patients with breast cancer will be enrolled to receive at least 4 cycles of EC chemotherapy, that is: epirubicin 100 mg/m2 and cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2.
Study Design: A multi-center, randomized, open-label, active-controlled phase III clinical trial Site Number: 14 sites(planned) , 12 sites(actual) Subject Number: 240

primary_outcome.measure: The efficacy of F-627 versus GRAN® in the first cycle of prophylactic treatment in subjects with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy, as assessed by the number of days in which ANC < 1.0 × 109/L in cycle 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of cycle 1（each cycle is 21 days）.
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the duration (days) of grade 3 or 4 (moderate and severe) neutropenia in cycle 1, that is, the number of days in which ANC < 1.0 × 109/L in cycle 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia as assessed by ANC（ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and ANC < 0.5 × 109/L, respectively）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence rate of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia (ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and ANC< 0.5 × 109/L, respectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: durations (days) of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia as assessed by ANC（ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and ANC < 0.5 × 109/L, respectively）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: in cycles 2-4, at the end of cycle 4（each cycle is 21 days.）
secondary_outcome.description: The durations (days) of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia (ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and < 0.5 × 109/L, respectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence and duration (days) of grade 4 neutropenia are all as assessed by ANC（ANC < 0.5 × 109/L）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence and duration (days) of grade 4 neutropenia (ANC < 0.5 × 109/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: overall duration (days) of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia as assessed by ANC（ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and ANC < 0.5 ×109/L, respectively）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, in overall 4 cycles（each cycle is 21 days）.
secondary_outcome.description: The overall duration (days) of grade 3 or 4 neutropenia (ANC < 1.0 × 109/L and ANC< 0.5 × 109/L, respectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence and duration (days) of grade 2 or above neutropenia are all assessed by ANC (ANC < 1.5 × 109/L)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence and duration (days) of grade 2 or above neutropenia (ANC < 1.5 × 109/L) in each cycle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of febrile neutropenia (FN) (defined as ANC < 1.0×109/L; a single measurement of body temperature > 38.3°C or a temperature ≥ 38.0 °C sustained over 1 h)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of febrile neutropenia (FN) (defined as ANC < 1.0×109/L; a single measurement of body temperature > 38.3 °C or a temperature ≥ 38.0 °C sustained over 1 hr)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The time (days) of ANC nadir recovers to 2.0 × 109/L

secondary_outcome.measure: The neutrophil count nadir from day 3 to day 13 of cycle 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 3 to day 13 of cycle 1（each cycle is 21 days）.
secondary_outcome.description: The ANC nadir from day 3 to day 13 of cycle 1

secondary_outcome.measure: the time（days）of ANC nadir returns to 2.0 × 109/L
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The time (days) of ANC nadir recovers to 2.0 × 109/L

other_outcome.measure: the potential immunogenicity of F-627 by testing anti-F-627 antibodies inserum
other_outcome.description: To evaluate the immunogenic potential of F-627 by testing serum anti-F-627 antibodies.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive F-627 (20 mg/dose, s.c.) on day 3 of each cycle, i.e., 48 ±4 h after the start of chemotherapy.

Subjects will receive GRAN® [5 μg/kg/day, s.c., once daily (± 4 h) up to 2 weeks or until neutrophil count returns to 5.0 ×109/L] on day 3 of each cycle, i.e., 48 ±4 h after the start of chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Recombinant Human Granulocyte Colony Stimulating Factor-Fc Fusion Protein

eligibility.gender_description: Female postoperative patients with breast cancer who require adjuvant chemotherapy, and are planned to receive at least 4 cycles of EC chemotherapy, namely epirubicin 100 mg/m2 + cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2;
